headline: Occidental’s CEO Is a Favorite of Warren Buffett’s. She’s Been a Bust for Investors.
summary: Since Hollub became CEO in April 2016, Occidental stock has been in the bottom 10 stocks among the 50 in the S&P oil and gas exploration and production index.

headline: Chevron Works to Restart Units at LA Refinery after Fire
summary: Chevron’s El Segundo refinery in California is producing fuels at reduced rates following last week’s massive fire, the supermajor said on Tuesday, adding it is working to restart units that were shut down after the incident.

raw.headline: Chevron Works to Restart Units at LA Refinery after Fire
raw.summary: Chevron’s El Segundo refinery in California is producing fuels at reduced rates following last week’s massive fire, the supermajor said on Tuesday, adding it is working to restart units that were shut down after the incident.

headline: How XOM Expects Oil Prices & Refining Margins to Impact Q3 Earnings

headline: Chevron Names Kevin McLachlan to Lead Exploration; Liz Schwarze to Retire
summary: HOUSTON, October 07, 2025--Chevron Corporation1 (NYSE: CVX) today announced Kevin McLachlan will become Vice President of Exploration, effective November 1. McLachlan will oversee the company’s worldwide exploration program. McLachlan will be based in Houston and succeed Liz Schwarze, who is retiring in February after 36 years of service to the company.

raw.headline: Chevron Names Kevin McLachlan to Lead Exploration; Liz Schwarze to Retire

headline: Shell Divests 27% Non-Working Interest in North Cleopatra Block
summary: SHEL sells a 27% non-working stake in Egypt's North Cleopatra block to QatarEnergy, while retaining operatorship and a 36% share.

headline: Energy Transition Update - US Renewable Energy Sector Poised for Substantial Growth
summary: The United States renewable energy sector is on a trajectory of substantial growth, expected to triple its capacity from 429.55 GW in 2024 to 1,002.13 GW by 2033. This expansion is driven by a combination of technological advancements, increasing investor interest, and supportive federal and state policies. Key factors include the implementation of Renewable Portfolio Standards, tax credits, and declining costs of solar photovoltaic (PV) and wind technologies. Despite challenges such as...
